name: Rhubarb Compote
description: This rhubarb compote is wonderful to have around, whether you eat it on pancakes, yogurt or just a spoon, and it couldn't be easier to make.

recipeInstructions.text: In a saucepan, combine rhubarb with sugar over low heat. When the rhubarb starts to soften, but before it falls apart, about 5 minutes, use a slotted spoon to transfer it to a bowl.

Cook down the remaining liquid in the pan until it thickens and turns syrupy, about 5 minutes longer. (This condenses and intensifies the rhubarb flavor.) Add the syrup to the bowl with the rhubarb and let cool. Compote will keep for at least a week in the fridge.

video.name: How to Make Rhubarb Compote
video.description: Rhubarb compote is one of the best things to have on hand in your refrigerator. Melissa Clark shows how to make it.
